Junha Roh

A Ph.D. Student
Computer Science and Engineering
Paul G. Allen School
University of Washington
[cv][email]

My research interests are in robotics, vision, and artificial intelligence. My advisors are Ali Farhadi and Dieter Fox. I also closely work with Andrzej Pronobis. I received M.S. and B.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at Seoul National University and I was advised by Kyoung Mu Lee. Prior to UW, I worked at Korea Institute of Science and Technology as a researcher.

A Fast TGV-l1 RGB-D Flow Estimation
Junha Roh, Hwasup Lim, Sang Chul Ahn
ISVC 2014 [link]

Robust Visual Tracking with Double Bounding Box Model
Junseok Kwon, Junha Roh, Kyoung Mu Lee, Luc van Gool
ECCV 2014 [link]

Visual tracking using the joint inference of target state and segment-based appearance models
Junha Roh, Dong Woo Park, Junseok Kwon, Kyoung Mu Lee
